body:
I don't think there is any real merit in discussing this further (as @rsc points out, all the technical arguments have been made).

From a social perspective, I want to urge people who think that this is ignoring the community, treating proposals unfairly or favoring Google employees to consider that their viewpoint and reading of this thread is very subjective. For example, to me, as a supporter of this change, this thread reads like making very clear technical arguments in favor that weren't disproved and I read @rsc's comment as very nuanced, balanced, admitting past failures but also giving a good justification of how this specific proposal differs from other proposals and not least of all technical.
I am not saying my viewpoint is correct (it's not. It's very subjective). I am saying please consider that there is a very different way to read all of this.
